content: **this is a pay what you want pattern use the code seashanty50 for 50% off the original price or use the code seashanty100 for a free copy thank you for your support introducing the sea shanty coaster pattern a practical addition to your crochet repertoire this design draws inspiration from nautical themes offering a stylish and functional way to protect your surfaces suitable for both beginners and experienced crocheters the pattern features straightforward stitches that create a visually appealing texture whether for personal use or as a thoughtful gift these coasters will enhance any coastal-inspired decor get ready to craft a timeless piece that combines utility with a touch of maritime charm this pattern is made in worsted weight yarn with a 4 5mm hook i think a synthetic or plant fiber is best for a coaster as you will want it to be easy care this coaster is worked in the round in double_crochet st you work increases every round to get it to the proper size and the last round adds a festive edging that is fun to make gauge is not crucial in such a small piece this pattern is written for one size which should be a perfect fit for most mugs if you find that it is too small/too large for your mug i encourage you to experiment with another gauge or the number of rnds this is a beginner friendly pattern it uses basic stitches and includes a photo tutorial at the end of the written instructions there are also links to video tutorials for all the special techniques thank you for choosing my pattern i hope you enjoyed it you may sell as many of the finished items as you wish but if you share on social media please give me credit @stopitharry on ravelry and link the pattern to its source if you have any questions or need pattern support please contact me @stopitharry on ravelry i appreciate your support thank you to my amazing testers divavonpurl /people/divavonpurl coffeebuddy /people/coffeebuddy fizzlllll /people/fizzlllll panacheplus /people/panacheplus yarnseed /people/yarnseed and dawnlambert88 /people/dawnlambert88 this pattern wouldn t be possible without you
